quotes.quote: How kind of you to remind me that standards are now optional.
Great job — if your job was to redefine mediocrity.
I admire your ability to always choose the path of least effort.
Sure, you could eat that… but then your jeans will keep reminding you about it.
Remember, abs are made in the kitchen… and so are excuses.
Your future self called. She said to put the fries down.
Go ahead, have it — your scale loves surprises.
Your goals called — they're tired of being ghosted.
The mirror doesn't lie — but it does keep receipts.
Don't worry, your goals will wait… right where you left them, next to that slice of cake.
Sure, you could eat that… but then your jeans might start a protest.
Your future self is watching… and silently judging.
Oh, you're 'bulking'? Cute. So is your snack drawer.
Your jeans called. They said they're not stretching any further.
That's not a cheat meal… that's a cheat week.
Your treadmill misses you.
Abs are canceled — thanks to you.
Your fridge light sees you more than the sun does.
If food is your love language, your waistline is fluent.
Every bite is a love letter to your future double chin.
Your gym membership is basically a charity donation at this point.
Your abs are in there… buried under witness protection.
Your cheat day has commitment issues… it never ends.
Your scale is tired of being the villain in your story.
Your jeans are applying for early retirement.
You say 'cheat day,' but your calendar says 'cheat life.'
That salad you skipped? Yeah, it told me it's filing a restraining order.
Wow, you've been so disciplined… I almost didn't recognize you without the snack in your hand.
If excuses burned calories, you'd be shredded by now.
That bite isn't worth the bloat.
Your goals called — they're starving.
Remember, the fridge light isn't a spotlight for your midnight performance.
Go ahead, eat it. I'm sure your 'metabolism' will understand.
